title: Lesson 15
paragraph: This lesson covers business and strategy, including organizational management and corporate tactics.

words.meaning: use of resources to achieve a desired outcome
words.example: The company leveraged its brand to enter new markets.

words.meaning: to combine or unify into a stronger whole
words.example: The firm consolidated its operations in Asia.

words.meaning: to expand into different areas or products
words.example: The company diversified its portfolio to reduce risk.

words.meaning: to dominate or control a market exclusively
words.example: The corporation monopolized the smartphone market.
The policy incentivized employees to improve productivity.

words.meaning: to assign responsibility or authority to someone else
words.example: The manager delegated tasks to her team.

words.meaning: to make less severe or serious
words.example: The company implemented measures to mitigate risks.

words.meaning: to take advantage of a situation for gain
words.example: They capitalized on the growing demand for electric cars.

words.meaning: to make more efficient and effective
words.japaneseMeaning: 合理化する、効率化する
words.example: The firm streamlined production to reduce costs.

words.japaneseMeaning: 再編成する、構造を変える
words.example: The company restructured its departments to boost efficiency.
